Dataset: Comprehensive Heart Disease Dataset (1190 instances, 11 features) + UCI Heart Disease Data (14 attributes)
Privacy Technique: Differential Privacy (noise added to gradients, privacy budget ε) , Blockchain technology , Smart Contracts (ERC-20) , Homomorphic encryption
Key Features: Attention-based feature selection , tree-based + DNN hybrid , 5 hidden layers , Adam optimizer , BCE loss function , data expansion techniques
Advantages/Findings: Balances privacy and accuracy ; transparent audit trail via blockchain ; achieves Balanced Metrics score of 1.594 at optimal settings ; enables continuous model updates without retraining

FL Approach: Federated Learning with FedAvg and FedProx
Model/Algorithm: SGD-DNN (5 hidden layers: 512, 256, 128, 64, 32 neurons) + DRL for nutrition
Dataset: ECG Heartbeat Categorization , Sunnybrook Cardiac MRI , Heart Disease Patient Records , UCI Heart Disease Data (nutrition)
Privacy Technique: Differential Privacy , Secure parameter sharing , Federated Averaging
Key Features: Multimodal data fusion (cardiac images, ECG, patient records, nutrition) , attention-based feature fusion , batch normalization , dropout (0.3) , Deep Q-Network for personalized nutrition
Advantages/Findings: Highest accuracy with multimodal fusion ; enables early detection and personalized lifestyle recommendations ; outperforms centralized models (99.12% vs 94.87%)

Privacy Technique: Secure weight aggregation , data locality preservation , privacy-preserving architecture
Key Features: Graph-structured representations from patient data , captures complex feature relations , only weights transmitted (not raw data)
Advantages/Findings: Outperforms GAT, 1D-CNN, and ML baselines ; robust, scalable, and generalizable ; maintains patient privacy with decentralized data

Model/Algorithm: SVM (linear kernel) , Neural Networks , Logistic Regression
Dataset: UCI Heart Disease Dataset (920 records from USA, Hungary, Switzerland; reduced to 740 after preprocessing)
Privacy Technique: Data partitioning across hospitals , local model training with only updates shared
Key Features: Natural partition across 4 hospitals (Cleveland, Long Beach VA, Hungary, Switzerland); SHAP interpretability analysis ; 14 key features used
Advantages/Findings: Federated SVM uncommon in literature ; interpretability reveals ST depression, chest pain type, and exercise-induced angina as key predictors ; privacy-preserving with reasonable accuracy trade-off

FL Approach: Asynchronous Federated Learning with temporally weighted aggregation
Model/Algorithm: Deep Neural Networks with R-SVM classifier , asynchronous deep/shallow layer updates
Dataset: DS1 and DS2 (from UCI and Switzerland; 303 records, 76 characteristics, 14 key features used)
Accuracy: DS1: 89.1% (6 nodes) ; DS2: 89.9% (10 nodes) - outperforms synchronous FL
Privacy Technique: Privacy-aware approach , local data deletion after use , asynchronous parameter updates
Key Features: Deep layers update less frequently than shallow layers ; temporally weighted aggregation ; TensorFlow Federated framework ; 5 clients with ~40 records each
Advantages/Findings: Better convergence for higher number of nodes ; reduced communication cost ; improved accuracy vs synchronous FL ; efficient network bandwidth usage ; flexible distributed learning

Model/Algorithm: Federated learning models for EHR prediction
Key Features: EHR-based prediction , collaborative training across institutions
Advantages/Findings: Demonstrates FL as a reliable approach for heart disease prediction while maintaining data security and privacy

Dataset: 10-year risk of coronary heart disease Kaggle dataset
Accuracy: Federated LR with SMOTE: AUC 0.7048 , Centralized LR: AUC 0.7081 ; Federated SVM: AUC 0.7340 , Centralized SVM: AUC 0.6962
Privacy Technique: Privacy-preserving collaborative training, decentralized patient data
Key Features: Addresses data imbalance with Random Over Sampling , Random Under Sampling , and SMOTE techniques; scalable architecture
Advantages/Findings: Federated SVM surpasses centralized ML models; maintains patient confidentiality while enabling collaborative CVD prediction; competitive performance with centralized approaches

FL Approach: Federated Learning with Weighted Conglomeration Optimization (FLWCO)
Model/Algorithm: FLWCO model with optimized weighted aggregation
Accuracy: Superior performance compared to standard FL approaches
Privacy Technique: Federated learning framework preserving patient privacy, distributed data processing
Key Features: Addresses privacy concerns in personalized ML, with weighted conglomeration optimization for improved model aggregation
Advantages/Findings: Enables personalized ML while overcoming privacy concerns; leverages distributed data to achieve accurate disease prediction

Dataset: ECG signals and vital signs for atrial fibrillation
Privacy Technique: Federated learning preserving ECG data privacy
Key Features: Continual learning approach, ECG signal processing , and vital signs integration
Advantages/Findings: Shows great promise in predicting atrial fibrillation using ECG signals while maintaining data privacy; enables continuous model improvement

Accuracy: High accuracy with a lightweight architecture
Privacy Technique: Personalized federated learning with active learning
Key Features: Lightweight design for resource-constrained devices, active learning for efficient data utilization, personalized models per client
Advantages/Findings: Tackles heterogeneous ECG data across clients; enables efficient arrhythmia detection with reduced computational requirements; personalized approach improves individual patient predictions
